text: Iâ€™ve had the Ring Battery Doorbell for a few months now, and it has completely transformed the way I secure and monitor my home. As someone who values both convenience and safety, this doorbell has been a game-changer in terms of functionality, ease of use, and peace of mind.First, the installation was incredibly straightforward. I was able to set it up myself in about 20 minutes, thanks to the clear instructions and the fact that it's wire-free. The battery lasts surprisingly long too, even with regular motion detection and video use. Iâ€™ve only had to recharge it a couple of times, and the process is quick and easy.The video quality is excellentâ€”crystal clear even in low light, which is essential for those early morning or late-night deliveries. The wide-angle lens gives a clear view of whoâ€™s at the door, and the motion detection feature is spot-on. I get instant alerts on my phone whenever someone is approaching, and I love that I can see and speak to visitors directly through the app. Whether Iâ€™m at home or out running errands, I can easily communicate with delivery people or guests, which is great for convenience and security.Another feature I love is the two-way audio. The sound quality is surprisingly clear on both ends, and Iâ€™ve been able to have full conversations with delivery drivers, neighbors, and even the occasional solicitor. The built-in siren also offers an added layer of securityâ€”if I ever feel unsafe, I can sound it directly from the app.The Ring app itself is intuitive and user-friendly, with everything you need in one place. You can review video clips, adjust settings, and even link it with other smart devices for an integrated security system. Itâ€™s so easy to use, even for someone who isnâ€™t particularly tech-savvy.In summary, the Ring Battery Doorbell has exceeded my expectations. Itâ€™s reliable, easy to install, and provides real-time alerts that help keep my home secure. The video quality and two-way communication make it stand out among other doorbell cameras, and I feel much more confident knowing I can monitor my doorstep from anywhere. If you're looking for a high-quality, user-friendly doorbell camera that doesnâ€™t require complicated wiring, this is definitely worth the investment!

text: First 2 days review:This product has great camera quality and because of the fish lens eliminates blind spots, even when placed at an angle.The Battery life is great considering I have it set to highly motion sensitivity, and it only loses 1-2%, at most 3% of battery per day.If you donâ€™t buy the extra adhesive place holder for this product, which I didnâ€™t, you need a drill capable of drilling 4 holes through the surface youâ€™d like to place it on. I marked a sharpee line on the drill bit just how far the wall plug goes so I knew how deep to drill. There is a tutorial for this on the app as well.Charging takes about an hour or 2 it seems so whenever Iâ€™m at home about once a month I can give it a charge, maybe less frequently than that considering its strong battery life.The ring app works smoothly and the lag is only about one second. Video and Audio quality are definitely a plus.A price of $50 and change per camera seems a fair deal in exchange for the additional layer of security. Especially with an upcoming holiday season.Iâ€™ll update this review when I learn about the subscription services and what it entails.

title: Best quality for the money

text: To start, buy the wired unit that comes with a rechargeable battery if you have an existing doorbell. Yes the 10 to 24 volt from your doorbell transformer will keep the battery charged. Yes the Ring doorbell will activate your existing doorbell chime so do not buy a separate chime. Donâ€™t panic when you first wire it to existing doorbell wires. Part of the install process is for th Ring doorbell to look for an existing chime and initialize or whatever it does to know it is there. Putting this in my review as I had a hard time finding this info on the vendor sites or any reviews.Setup is easy. The hardest part for my install was getting the mounting plate to be flat enough for the Ring doorbell to click into this mount. I have a stucco wall which creates flex in the mounting plate when attached. To get it to click I had to remove one of four screws and loosing others so that I could get my fingers on the back of the mounting plate to be able to get it flat to click to the doorbell. The mounting plate is plastic and easily flexes which will not allow the security snap to click into a locked position. Then to get the doorbell to not move, I added a shim behind.Installed the doorbell is a bit clunky looking but video is good and works well taking video in the dark.Hope this helps others.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2024
title: Here is info hard to find

title: Quality product

text: The device itself worked great (5 stars) until it croaked after I connected a solar charger to it. It started charging perfectly (blue ring lighted and blinking).The next day I realised that there weren't any notifications, and when I checked, it was "offline".No response from the bell button.....it was dead.I removed it and plugged in the regular charger........nothing.....(yes, the charger is good.......the same one that was used to full-charge it when I got it).That's it for me and RING. I'm gone.If you opt for a solar charger, use one from RING themselves. Connecting anything else is at your own risk (and probable expense).Shalom.Update (Edit).So.......Ring reached out to me concerning my review. Phone calls, emails, ect.I explained the situation described above, and they promised to send me a new door bell, which they did.When I was about to set up the new one I noticed that the old (dead) one was showing full-charge on the app. I tried a reset (held both the orange And the bell buttons down simultaneously) and it came on. It came on and worked perfectly. I reinstalled it to its mount, and it's been going well ever since (approx a month).The new (unopened) one? I promised the rep to ship it back to them. They "can't provide a shipping label" which they initially promised, and told me to keep the new one. I dont need nor want it. I tried to ship it back myself, but I'm not going to pay $140.00 to UPS it back to the States (I'm in the Caribbean).So......5 stars ðŸŒŸ it is for ring. Great product and support (subscription, history playback, etc).Battery is holding up well, and alerts are excellent (rarely misses).Only connect chargers approved by them.Shalom.P.S.Who need a  Ring doorbell for Christmas?

text: My original Ring Doorbell (purchased 3/19) died, and this one was pretty affordable so I just ordered it.  Itâ€™s terrific, and the picture is much improved.Iâ€™m taking off a star because, apparently in an effort to make the construction cheaper, they changed the design in a way that will make re-charging a PITA.  On the original, the connections for a wired doorbell were on the wall bracket (along with electronic components), so to take the unit off to charge (Iâ€™ve had to do it about 2x per year) you just popped it off, super easy.On the new unit, the wall bracket is just a piece of plastic (no electronics), and you need to screw the wired doorbell wires directly to the doorbell.  Not a huge deal to set up, but it means that every time I need to take the doorbell off to charge it (the charging port is on the back), Iâ€™ll need to unscrew the wires (and then re-attach them).  This will make the re-charging process a fair bit more cumbersome.That said, I like the doorbell and the ring app is well designed and easy to use.  I just wish they hadnâ€™t designed in a re-charging hassle in an effort to save a bit of $$.

title: Helps with monitoring package deliveries

text: We've had the Ring Doorbell camera for just over a month now. Some things I've learned:Do not expect this to pick up license plates - you can't even read the front plates of our cars parked 10 feet away. There are other home camera packages sold on Amazon that I plan on getting for better home surveillance.This is not a 24 hour recording device. It only starts recording once it picks something up or if you go into live view, and there's a slight lag to it, meaning the deliver guy might be walking away by the time it started recording.You may have to be creative in mounting it. I have siding, so it wouldn't be on a completely flat surface. I cut a piece of pvc board to get full contact.If you don't want to mess with recharging it, wire it into your existing bell wires. The terminal screws are right on the back. I did not realize they were the terminals screws at first, because of how they looked. You don't need to remove any covers to get to them. It will charge very slowly (as designed), but eventually it will get to 100%.You get a 30 day free subscription when you buy this. Ours just ran out, and it was very telling of how this product is designed for you to need the subscription. It is not just that you lose the recording of videos. I could live with that. All day I've been getting tons of motion alerts. It seems to be picking up cars driving down the street that are 30 feet out from the front door. When you are on the free subscription, it has person identification, meaning it isn't alerting you for cars driving by. When you are off the subscription, it alerts you for everything and just says motion alert for it all. I kept adjusting the sensitivity down trying to get it to not pick up cars and it seems like that was doing nothing. So, we caved, and paid for a subscription. As of right now it's $49.99 if you pay for the whole year, for one device. It's almost $10 more if you want to go month to month.It is nice having a camera at the front door, and it's nice to be at work and be able to see the front yard. I know the moment a package is delivered - sometimes you don't know even when you are home. I set up an automated message which starts talking after a few seconds of someone pushing the doorbell. It tells them we aren't home and that they can leave a message. This has worked well for solicitors, as they seem to leave as soon as they hear the message. We no longer have to peak out the window to see who's at the door. It just bothers me that they strip away all the features if you don't get on a subscription plan.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2024
title: Consider the total cost

text: Amazon feedback: 3 starsI had ordered a wired doorbell with chime. It got accidentally returned with another item. Amazon took the note of it, promised to return it as soon as it gets processed in their return center & didnt do anything about it. I waited for a month and later followed up with CS. They were nice enough to send me a replacement, as items that go to their warehouse is like going to blackhole. Anyways, I went to setup & found that my house door bell doesnt have wiring! Again returned. Then I decided to buy this as it runs on battery.Doorbell:Like other Ring products, this door bell comes in nice clean box with all the required accessories. Setting up was a breeze. Charged it up & mounted on given bracket in no time. The door bell allows many customizations wrt motion detection as well as integrate these customizations to the ring security system mode. I dont want to explain much into my home security configuration, but overall the camera gets added to existing system seamlessly. The battery life is something I am curious about as well. I will update the review if that drains too fast. I ended up ordering some more Ring stick on cameras. Lol.

title: Awesome edition to my Ring system
